definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The Song Mountain was named as the "Oriental Gibraltar" by American military experts.
sentences.chinese: 松山被美国军事家称为“东方直布罗陀”。

sentences.english: Zeng Guofang was an outstanding strategist in China's modern history.
sentences.chinese: 曾国藩是中国近代杰出的军事家。

sentences.english: Sun Bin word burling, the Warring States period, a famous military strategist.
sentences.chinese: 孙膑字伯灵，战国时期著名军事家。

sentences.english: San Martin was an outstanding militarist in the Independence Movement of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: 圣马丁是拉丁美洲独立运动中涌现出的著名军事家。

sentences.english: Big way division militia movement has attracted interest in domestic and foreign military experts.
sentences.chinese: 大办民兵师运动也吸引了国内外军事家的兴趣。

sentences.english: Lin Boqu, Chinese soldier and revolutionary, died of illness in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 中国军事家和革命家林柏渠在北京病逝。

sentences.english: Sun Bin Military tactics is the masterpiece of a famous military strategist, Sun Bin, in the Warring Period.
sentences.chinese: 《孙膑兵法》是战国时期著名军事家孙膑的代表作。

sentences.english: As a militarist , he must have tactical awareness.
sentences.chinese: 作为一位军事家，他必须有战术意识。

sentences.english: Turner benefited from the great commander's deeds in another way too.
sentences.chinese: 透纳还从这位伟大军事家的行为中获得了其他好处。

definition: variant of 開國元勳|开国元勋, founding figure (of country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company, school etc
founding figure (of a country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company or school etc
important official or statesman (in feudal China)
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
School of Diplomacy of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) whose leading advocates were Su Qin 蘇秦|苏秦[Su1 Qin2] and Zhang Yi 張儀|张仪[Zhang4 Yi2]
